result.execSummary:
The defendant Aldo Fragoso-Tlacuatl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs (bail to apply).
The Court is imposing the applicable fees, assessments, court costs, and surcharges, including a DNA assessment (bail to apply).  And, you may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77. The Court orders the DOC to collect any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of max 25% of any amounts provided in secs 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the defendant is released from confinement are to be paid as a condition of the extended supervision.  Any monetary mounts that remain unpaid when the sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a judgment against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can then proceed under sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.

Defendant to undergo a sexual offender evaluation and comply with treatment. Defendant to have no unsupervised contact with persons under the age of 18 except when working.
NO CONTACT ORDER REMAINS.
Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

timeConds.notes: Court ordered the defendant to serve 10 days in the House of Correction with huber for work.  The defendant has a report date of 12.7.15 before 12pm.

DOC request to clarify sentence on counts one and two.

Defendant Aldo Fragoso-Tlacuatl in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sworn as interpreter: Dawn Maldonado. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 6 months in the House of Correction with credit of 3 days time served. 
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant ordered to serve 6 months in the House of Correction.  AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years with the following conditions:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Defendant to undergo a sexual offender evaluation and comply with treatment. Defendant to have no unsupervised contact with persons under the age of 18 except when working. 
NO CONTACT ORDER REMAINS.
*Court ordered the defendant to serve 10 days in the House of Correction with huber for work.  The defendant has a report date of 12.7.15 before 12pm. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs (bail to apply).
The Court is imposing the applicable fees, assessments, court costs, and surcharges, including a DNA assessment (bail to apply).  And, you may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77. The Court orders the DOC to collect any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of max 25% of any amounts provided in secs 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the defendant is released from confinement are to be paid as a condition of the extended supervision.  Any monetary mounts that remain unpaid when the sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a judgment against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can then proceed under sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.
Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Aldo Fragoso-Tlacuatl in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as interpreter: Alberto Aguila.   On motion of the State, Court ordered charges amended to Counts 1-2 Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), 939.51()(b) Misds.
AS TO BOTH COUNTS:   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Aldo Fragoso-Tlacuatl in court.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense counsel is ill and unable to appear.   Sworn as interpreter: Liesl Monroy. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Aldo Frasoso-Tlacuatl in court with attorney Roberto R. Ledesma.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.
